ld28DyC-PjOfQDUtSAHFvA.text: I am born and raised in NJ and was happy to get a taste of home.  Chicken parm sub was awesome and my daughter wolfed down the French toast.  Owners and staff are super nice and service was great.  Fantastic addition to the neighborhood.

BQ8xsti2-0qYDINDoxdDmQ.text: We went last night and had an incredible meal. The portions were huge and more importantly the food was some of the best we had ! The place is beautiful, service superb, Jessica our waitress was amazing and the owner who cooks everything himself couldn't  be more concerned that our experience was a great one. Keep up the great work Jimmy and can't to bring all our friends back !!  Scott & Karen Rinder

eeI9MBEXv6aGSoN_DkcknA.text: If you haven't eaten here yet, for shame.  Single handedly the best place to eat in NoDa.  Ride the light rail in, hang a right on Donaldson and it'll be a couple blocks down on the left.  You can't miss it, IT'S A RED HOUSE.  :)  Seriously though, I've been going here with my wife and have tried just about everything and not once have I been disappointed.  Go.  Now.  What are you waiting for?  The staff is all fantastic,  the owners are the sweetest most amazing people.  Do yourself a favor and go.

pToP7uzXW06oCU8U0PW1mw.text: Honestly some of the worst food I've ever seen/tasted. Party of 5 hardly anyone took more than 2 bites of their meals. The Red House misses the mark in many ways and I wouldn't recommend anyone trying it for themselves. Pasta looked like it came from a can, toasted hoagie rolls passed off as table bread - and a cheesesteak with potatoes in it (yes you heard right - potatoes). Save your time while in Noda and go to one of the reputable establishments. Would have asked for a refund if we weren't with a group and in a hurry.

photos.caption: Photo of The Red House Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

DBnHuia3nlPvq50zCzU3sg.text: Great disappointment, ordered the Chicken Teriyaki perhaps a better name would be Greek/Italian Chicken with a cup of Teriyaki sauce.  Cubed chicken with greek/Italian seasoning on a hoagie like roll with a cup of teriyaki sauce.  Excellent Tea! Waitress was awesome!  I love and cook great Italian food (no spice or True ingredient spared when cooking i.e. lasgana) this place lost its spices from Italy.  Another painful journey!

txrZEGd0Z90MljQKBXS1Ag.text: Jimmy and Joanie were sweet to our kids.  Service was great!  Arlie got a tour of the ice cream.

photos.caption: Photo of The Red House Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Red House Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Red House Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

Aayrai4S1BQS4Oj5PCOxXg.text: The hype for this place was huge, and for me so was the letdown.  It's just basic dinner food that you'll find anywhere else, likely for a better price.

gPeh0BGjGsaBedNlztCV7A.text: Had the Opportunity to meet the Owner and his wife. Great people- wait staff was friendly too. Dinner and desserts were delicious.

l9QZ39JqoV1I2iizuCWKRg.text: Food was well below average. Pasta came out cold, the sausage was tasteless, and fries were soggy. Very nice servers to get it to two stars...

NflQLgI_9VYiSbYSZr7kzw.text: This is my 2nd time here and I can now say everything that I have ever ordered from here is delicious.  That includes sausage and peppers sandwich, minestrone soup, house potatoes, cheese sticks, meatloaf sandwich, ice cream, cookies, and French fries.   So far that is all I can personally endorse but when you are battling 1000 I would say you have a quality place.  Give me some time and I am sure I will be able to tell you everything on The menu is great!!!

FeH9VyqE2_WK2GI2xQ4e7Q.text: The staff were very pleasant, that was about the only positive of my to-go order.  I ordered a chicken parm hero which also comes with fries or o-rings...which made the $13 price a little more realistic.  The sandwich was probably the worst attempt at chicken parm I have ever had.  The bread was terrible, like mass-produced hamburger roll terrible.  The chicken was clearly a frozen patty diced up and swimming in canned sauce and covered with cheese that was melted, however not browned so that just screams "I was microwaved".  I had high hopes since the neighborhood desperately needs a good Italian spot, but was quite disappointed and won't be back.  If burger king still served their Italian Chicken Sandwich, it would be head and shoulders better than my experience at Red House.

KaJETJ9aublKQ-uH3_qOHQ.text: This cool new place has been putting itself together in NODA for quite some time now.....LOVE the location and they did a great job making the interior comfy and relaxing.  Its still in its soft opening phase and are awaiting their liquor license.  I had the chicken parm from the limited soft opening menu and it was very good.  I look forward to this place opening up fully and trying the rest of the menu.  Great addition to the neighborhood and I will be back for a visit soon.

JvdvfZtmN2TY6rSRPEeP_A.text: What a great place! The hand cut home made French fries were excellent. I had the Phili cheese steak and it was to big to pick up and not make a mess. It had real cheddar cheese and I think it also had potato chunks and was also great. My coworker had the chicken parm sandwich, took one bite and said, "we are coming back tomorrow."   The staff was quick, friendly and really paid attention. Even the kitchen staff came out to make sure everything was good and even offered to refill our drinks.  Guess I know where we are having lunch tomorrow!

-hLwOs10eKeU-ap5-j14nw.text: Food was awesome every thing was hot fresh and could tell it was homemade even the fries..we ordered the wings.the bbq is great..we came. Ack later that day with our kids for ice cream round back..ice cream was quality..there wine shakes where tasty

udA4lcNPLdLEL54-1uDB1g.text: Red House's menu is unique, the service is impeccable, and the owner is kind hearted. Loved my food and experience here.

I7hHCcqwqxrLHMGGS0f6mg.text: This is a very warm and inviting place with delicious food! My favorites were the caesar salad, the meatball parmesan sandwich, and the green beans and onions. Their ice cream was also delicious and they had a lot of flavors to choose from. All of it came out within a reasonable amount of time and our waitress was super friendly! Plus, at the end of the night I forgot my to go box and they ran outside to bring it to me. Super nice of them! I would say this place is great for families and friends.

N8CPpJ_sBZYLHGkZZhfV-A.text: I'm lucky enough to live within walking distance from Red House and for real this place is amazing. They do everything in house and you can tell. The owners Jimmy and Jodie are really nice, they give the restaurant the family style vibe Noda seemed to be lacking. It's the perfect spot to take visiting relatives or friends from out of town who don't want bars or tacos. I've heard people complain about the prices but I don't really think there's an issue. It's by no means cheap bar food so don't expect those prices, but you definitely won't feel like you're paying too much. And once you see the owner make your lunch and you taste the best thing you'll eat all week, you won't mind paying $10 for a sandwich. Also they nail their serving sizes, you gotta get the fries because they give you too many and they're amazing. Overall, I'm extremely happy to call these guys neighbors. When you are hungry in Noda and feel like sitting down and eating something healthier than Jack Mac, this is the place to do it. absolutely the most underrated spot around!  They also have awesome desserts! Jodie makes all their pies and cakes, they have the best in Charlotte without a doubt. Cheesecake is the classic but there's so many there you should really just try them all. They also got the ice cream bar in the back, so you can skip pop bar and get a good old fashion cone!

ndxxgqxLGx8WMJ4MKo7InQ.text: We went to the restaurant with a group of 7 and the staff was very warm, welcoming and accommodating. The restaurant had a very homey feel with a lovely outdoor seating area. They readily modified meals to cater to our gluten free requirements. We all had different dishes and they were all very delicious. Definitely will go back.

PR2xElQA2Rppf0rBHE85Yg.text: First time on Yelp and did it to leave a review for this new spot in hope of its success. First time eating here, the staff accommodated our large group with kids, had the table all setup with a quick call ahead.  Staff was amazing, super friendly, and attentive. Food was delicious, from apps to deserts it was great!  I hope that this place continues to get busy, from my experience they deserve it!

ZWCAU75ejGk7dcDVefZntQ.text: Food was good, waitress was very friendly. Hard to find a place to park which is typical of all NoDa businesses.

-AFTaTH4kfVSgE3-bT0C8g.text: Great new addition to Noda! I had the sausage onion and pepper entree which was delicious. As sides I had mashed potatoes and succotash, which were also great. Big portions, great flavor, and quick service.  Friendly service and attentive wait staff. The homemade cheesecake is top of the line!! I would highly recommend this restaurant for anyone looking for high quality Italian home cooking.

obpyoYqUqsfb3vk8x-L7tg.text: This was a great spot in Noda for a good Italian home cooked meal. They were really fast too. Good service. Amazing food. We ordered the pasta bolognese and fettuccini Alfredo with chicken. Both were amazing!! Very fresh food and good amount too. I got the spinach salad which was perfect. Also we had a Caesar  salad too which was great. Overall, strongly recommend! A little bit pricey but would 100% go again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Red House Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Caesar salad was perfect , spinach salad amazing fresh fruit
Photo of The Red House Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Alfredo was unreal. Bolognese was perfect meat sauce

vvwvC68yIGjxeXMQl-DF4A.text: After trying this a few more times, I have to say that it really hasn't wowed me. I have seen staff arguing, red potatoes everywhere in food that shouldn't have potatoes, and a lot of just mediocre things to come out of that kitchen. Desserts, pasta, beer. Keep it simple and you won't be disappointed.

KE-wgDz-r6aWxIw5KC2FSA.text: LOVE this place! It's the definition of a good ol' family run business. Mom makes the desserts (pecan pie was amazing) and Naomi, daughter, has been our server twice now. She remembered us from our first visit and welcomed us back. First time we went in for breakfast on a Saturday. Super affordable and got a HUGE breakfast sandwich. Potatoes were amazing and my coffee was always full. Went in for a second time tonight to try the dinner and was more than pleased! My husbands family is from Long Island, New York and they are picky about service and their Italian food. They left tonight RAVING about the place. I'm so happy this place is here and we are deeming it our local go-to spot now. I can honestly say we can't wait to come back.

dC3LM53pPyxQI7H3A5-jbw.text: I was shocked that we went for dinner last night and when we got there at 7pm, we were the only guests there! Upon leaving, there were a total of 3 other guests.  The food was so so disappointing! 3 of us got chicken Parmesan. The sauce tasted like jarred pizza sauce and was just awful! The chicken was very chewy and rubbery. One of the worst chicken Parma ever. So shocked as the reviews are so good.   Don't waste your money here!

ocVDdOIDkU2e8qh-dUOxpw.text: Great food, great service! If you're looking for a family owned, family run local business that will cater to your appetite, look no further. And if you're vegan (or even if you're not) you simply must try the Impossible Burger. Delicious! Oh... And the sweet potato fries, too.

YklZ4Fopfw9FCUs3eJjavQ.text: Gives you the True home cooked Italian feel! The best chicken parm sandwich I've had in a while. highly recommend to go!!

syHO4DVi174tfoHo3IkC7A.text: Red House Cafe... or Sam's Club Lean Cuisine sample handout? From the moment we walked in, we were accosted with an overly loud karaoke singer, an unpleasant host, and walls smattered with Hobby Lobby clearance section "art". We were seated quickly and unintelligibly questioned by our whispering host turned waitress about what drinks we would like before having an opportunity to look over the drink menu. We asked for waters to start and when they came, ordered a beer and a cider along with mozzarella sticks, again unable to hear whatever the waitress/host was muttering under her breath. The appetizer came out promptly and was actually decent, but I'd be happy with mozz sticks from Applebee's in a pinch, so who cares. We finished the app and were discussing loudly about the food we'd already decided to order because our waitress/host was nowhere to be seen. Be mindful, there were only 6 tables occupied at the time. When our church mouse of a waitress/host reappeared, floundering like she was serving a wedding party of 200, we ordered our food, fettuccini Alfredo and spaghetti and meatballs. Simple, right? The food came out timely. Mine was as described, while my girlfriend's was missing the garlic bread. I flagged down the other waiter and asked if she could get some bread, to which he made a joke about the waitress/host not liking her. Uncomfortable. The garlic bread was more than likely butter splattered on a hot dog bun with a dash of garlic salt. Then we tasted the food. Mine, the fettuccini, was mostly thick milk and overdone soggy noodles with a couple specs of pepper from a shaker. Hers, the spaghetti and meatballs, was Ragu at best with the aforementioned soggy noodles and to top it off, raw meatballs. The meatballs looked fine until she cut into them revealing raw hamburger meat. We stopped eating, decided to ask for the check and put our plates to the side. I told our waitress/host that the meatballs were raw and I didn't want to pay for that entree. She dropped her jaw in disbelief and briskly walked the plate back to the kitchen. She came back with our check and a mumbled apology and some explanation of how the cook does the meatballs and that every other one that day was cooked thoroughly. Needless to say, we will never return. If you're a big fan of unseasoned Lean Cuisine but are too lazy to microwave one yourself, I'd suggest this place for you.   P.S. we spent $40 (after removing the price of an entree) for this garbage.

wJmK0QBZ5Xpur92_rZNVTA.text: This is such a great place to go for a nice, warm meal. The foods on the menu (a rather large menu) make you feel like you're at home, and so does the cozy atmosphere!   My boyfriend and I visited a while ago, and we both enjoyed what we ordered. The meatloaf was super, and so were those potatoes! When we visited, they had a limited menu and no wine/beer, but I can't wait to get back and try something from their full menu! Welcome to Noda, Red House!

kbwDUmk17gDSg8KaR_k9Kw.text: Took part in a food tour and stopped at the Red House Cafe.  Excellent food, amazing drinks especially the sangria milkshake and an awesome experience.  Next time I'm in town I want to try their breakfast.

SSMPardy_7KhL29ndPDiEA.text: I honestly wanted this place to be good.  Unfortunately, the food is microwaved.  The pasta is overcooked.  It is expensive.  There is nothing Italian about it.  I tried it twice and was equally disappointed each time.

XN5JeCHZTjjq8dcxKXmxNw.text: This is my favorite place to go when I am in Noda. The food is great the staff is wonderful and the atmosphere is perfect. Two thumbs up and make sure not to skip dessert! Yummy!

tKg25DOz2f0T-c2PLGBb4w.text: Loved this place.  The food was fantastic. We ordered the Fettuccini with chicken and it was creamy and delicious. Nice amount of sauce. The Lasagna was delicious and the meatballs are tender and so flavorful. Jimmi and Joani are such great people. They came over to make sure everything was good. We will definitely be back.

uD9pwn0Y65ncugWWHWr9GQ.text: Very satisfied with the Red House! I've been a few different times since they are in walking distance from my job and house in Noda. This is a family owned restaurant and the owners are absolutely wonderful. The food is great (pasta, salads, and sandwiches) and the bakery sweets are heavenly. Staff is all very attentive and welcoming. Love that they remodeled one of the old original mill houses and kept its character. It's nice to walk in and feel like you're getting a home cooked family meal. I would highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of The Red House Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

Eu4Z069Z196TyniIxrYBZQ.text: Been here for breakfast, brunch, and dinner. All were wonderful!  Traditional breakfast with their own touch. Potatoes are cooked perfectly crisp. For dinner, the pasta dishes and sandwiches were awesome. I've taken guests here multiple times because the wait staff is friendly and there's something for everyone on the menu.

zlo6t9scIh6sIXvKUFz6Fw.text: We came for breakfast, got the field worker sandwich and the western omelette with Taylor ham and both were out of this world! We were so impressed with the breakfast offerings we took our friendly servers suggestion at the chicken parmesan sandwich which was also spectacular! Needless to say we'll be back for dinner!

DjZk_ccwAujnO_12hhL27Q.text: This place is one of a kind.  The only Italian food in NoDa, and it's worth it.  The interior is so homey and quaint, ambiance is nice, day or night.  I've eaten here on more than one occasion and was thoroughly impressed each time.  The fettuccine alfredo with chicken is my favorite, but the chicken parmesan is stellar!!!  They have tables outside around a 200 year old tree, music, and ice cream!!!  Come in and visit with the owners Jimi and Joanie and get a little taste of New Jersey.  Everyone there is very kind, and happy to serve you.

Bus1HruCSGsZv1__qXZiCA.text: Excellent ice cream served with a friendly smile! The walk up window is a great addition to NoDa.

G0o5l8lvzBI1DBT0HDW__g.text: Stumbled upon this place when the wait for Cabo Fish Taco was too long and we are so glad we did!  Great Italian food and even better owners who were so personable and actually do all the cooking!!! The have the freshest ingredients and homemade desserts! Can't wait to go back to try their breakfast!! Will be coming back soon!

P5Q8I_6GcL-71mZ3snuyDQ.text: My first visit here was on Saturday 1/5/19 for breakfast. I have always been a pancakeasaurus, and I had heard that they make them from scratch. It was a " no brainner", that I had to try them. They were awesome! Topped with real butter and " to die for" genuine maple syrup. I had a side of bacon, perfectly cooked, and superb coffee! The service was excellent and the atmosphere delightful. They play a very nice selection of mellow, yet upbeat music, and no commercials!   I was by myself, so I sat at the bar. I struck up a conversation with the fellow next to me, who had worked there as a waiter in the past. Turns out he's a regular there, because he's in love with the food. I can certainly see why!  Jimmy, the owner, came by to say hello. Nicest guy you could ever meet. In fact everyone there are so so pleasant. They really make you feel at home! I was amazed that the restaurant was sparsely populated. This place is a well kept secret! Part of me hesitates to write this review, for fear that in the near future, it could well become difficult to get a seat once the secret is out!

46oJcHs11NImvqYZMm74aQ.text: Omg!!!!! Talk about the best Alfredo sauce in town!!! The food was amazing. Tried the lasagna and chicken Alfredo and it blew me away! Their ice cream is also super good finished off with a warm gooooeeeeyyyyy chocolate chip cookie! The owners are super nice and came out to meet us. Def will be coming back!

ZtKd8KVp5pBE90y9H_XAoQ.text: I've walked by this place so many times and never stopped. Not sure why. It is really good!! Service was great too. If you go to Noda, you need to give it a try.

photos.caption: Photo of The Red House Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sooooo good!!!! Omg!!

2UXWrMSXl6InjBBO0ADf1w.text: This restaurant is confused - the name, ambiance, decor, menu, and pricing are all out of sync with each other.   Cafe implies sandwiches and soups, but the menu has an odd combination of Italian cuisine and bar food (i.e. mozzarella sticks). The casual decor and home-style ambiance implied low prices, but all of the pasta entrees were around $15, which I found to be wayyyy too high for the quality of dining experience.  Goose and I ended up ordering the homemade pizzas, which both the hostess and server talked up. Perhaps we're spoiled by quick service pizza establishments (i.e. Blaze, Inizio), but it took over 30 minutes to make and bring two personal pizzas. The pizzas were actually pretty good, which is what saved this review/experience.  All in all, it's way too pricey for what you get there. I recommend they lower prices ASAP or else I predict they won't be around very long.

uZ3jj9kr7AgY69uajKd9vQ.text: Don't waste your time, at all ....I don't like to give one star, so I landed on two.  I'm disappointed in the overall experience at The Red House Cafe. I knew it was a humble exterior and hoped to be greeted with more than a few "southern charm" quotes about sweet tea on the walls inside, but that's the extent of the vibes. The menu was fairly large. Mostly southern spins on food and comfort tastings. There were vegetarian/veganish options so it worked.   The service had little knowledge about the menu and seemed to be spread thinly; oddly enough there were only three tables in at the time.   We ordered. We waited. Waited. Witnessed a Togo order wait an extended period of time and then decline his order once he received it because it didn't look very good. Waited more....Asked where our food was (we ordered a salad with no meat, an omelet and veggie burger with fries). We waited more. 1 hour after ordering our food arrived. Subpar display and a Taste that matched.   To the defense of the staff; they apologized and offered free cookies/bakery items, but it was too late. We literally didn't have any time to spare we had been there for two hours and were late for our next adventure.   Save yourself the time and maybe go in for a Pastry or wine.   This was my plate I ordered the veggie burger, no bun with sweet potato fries... looks a kids meal.

photos.caption: Photo of The Red House Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

uBMecb00nLpq8992phbLBQ.text: I'm a big supporter of new and old businesses in NODA since I live here and want to see them succeed. Win-Win all around with everything in walking distance.  Red House Cafe (RHC) is a cute red house that serves Italian style food with a few other options like sandwiches, burgers, salads and deserts. Finally got around to trying RHC during the first heavy snow fall of 2018. I have to admit I was expecting so much more with the food quality, presentation and taste from the dinner service. The service was ok since there was one person on tables but also working the wine bar which is expected it's freaking snowing outside.  We ordered the chicken teriyaki and the meat loaf. The presentation of the chicken teriyaki was a bit mushy like and wish the menu would have mentioned peppers, onions and potatoes. The asparagus was softer than my liking and wish it had been skinned as it's easier and more pleasing to eat. The succotash was great.  The meat loaf had good flavors but way to much breading added. I tasted more of the breading than actual beef. The mash potatoes were extremely buttery to where you could barely taste the potatoes. The green beans were very mushy and again buttery so didn't really enjoy it. We also felt for the price of the wine we would have received more and they should splurge on wine glasses with stems. This could have been what was available because of the weather but wanted to mention.  We believe this was a one-off because of the weather so we'll try dinner service again and heard great things about their breakfast so we'll be back. I definitely plan on updating my review based on next visit.

1cXQxtf-QUkptoDZ2dE2Iw.text: I am literally crying tears right now about the money I wasted here the other night. I sat for awhile thinking about how to word this and if I even wanted to, since it was just my first visit.  The person on the phone was nice when I placed my to go order. The environment seemed nice and intimate.  The side salad was not the freshest. The Italian dressing was very basic. The baked ziti was not good. There was no baked, cheesy top like you would expect.  The sauce and cheese were mixed together like a vodka sauce, I prefer red.  The noodles were way over cooked.  I like al dente, and this was far from it.  I couldn't eat it.  I was pretty depressed over it.  The bread is good.   Ok so, I had high hopes for this place. The menu looks good and there is a variety of foods to choose from, perhaps I chose the wrong thing.  I would be willing to try this place again and see how the other dishes taste.

photos.caption: Photo of The Red House Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Baked Ziti-not recommended

fhhO1ouIoxKBlDe4YhQUnQ.text: We stopped by for the first time today and were not disappointed! They all recommended the lasagna, so I tried it, even though I'm not a huge fan of ricotta, and I must say...it was delicious.   We had their hot wings as an appetizer and we were kind of blown away. Definitely among the top three wings we've tried around Charlotte and we're pretty much wing connoisseurs.  They also had good tunes playing and a really cozy atmosphere. We will be back!

DcFJj10AjbdrqflYe4a7VQ.text: Fantastic outside eating space!  Lots of tables, shade by a giant tree, and fenced  off.  Menu had great choices. I had the chicken teriyaki sub, Sean had the meatball sub.  Both came with delicious fries.  The sandwiches were very tasty, and our server was really nice.  Perfect lunchtime break for me!

photos.caption: Photo of The Red House Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Red House Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Red House Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

-mQ_Mq8Khr48U-aovFjTKg.text: Great find on a crappy weather day. Warm and inviting old house in NODA. Ample portions, great burgers cooked to order and Italian favorites. Grab a dessert and ice cream and relax with friends.

photos.caption: Photo of The Red House Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Rare burger, well seasoned, with over easy egg and gooey mozz.
Photo of The Red House Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brownie with vanilla ice cream
Photo of The Red House Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheeseburger and fries

d6zU-oEOlB62JTb-pk83kQ.text: I went on a Sunday afternoon and got the Chicken Parmigiana sandwich. The chef brought it out to me and it did not disappoint. You get a lot of sandwich for $10 and the fries were fantastic. Next time I will get the lasagna.

MZd0xccEm7D3H3qzkThmEg.text: What saved this review from a 2 is the ambience from the lovely patio area which proved to be dog friendly.   Wait staff was pleasant and seated us quickly outside.   First dish was mozzarella appetizers, which were small and cost over $1 ea. They were fine.  The entrees came, and the side salad was a tiny bowl of romaine.  I ordered the alfredo with chicken which was low on sauce and flavor. I didn't even want my left overs. My friend got the hot dog with onion rings. Again disappointed. The hot dog came with soup chili on it soaking the entire bun creating a hot mess you had to eat with a fork and knife.  The onion rings we were so excited for, were over breaded and some still cold.  Overall not impressed and won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Red House Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Low on sauce and flavor
Photo of The Red House Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States. Overbreaded

GaZpdxgym_6wF1iGCqZFVA.text: My boyfriend and I stopped in for breakfast and really enjoyed our time. The cafe is intimate with an open kitchen so you can see the chefs preparing the food. Our waitress was very nice and attentive. I ordered the chocolate chip pancakes and my boyfriend got an omelet. I want to try them for lunch or dinner one day soon.

photos.caption: Photo of The Red House Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

K-tSs4PeQXeOgyPGvv1_6Q.text: Went to eat there on a Sunday night because we wanted some Italian food.  We both really enjoyed our meals.  I had the meatball sub and my wife had the ravioli.  We both ordered side salads (hers came with it).  We both left with a box.  I really enjoyed the meatballs and their sauce was excellent.    We ate inside because it was hot, but the outside area was really nice.  When the weather isn't so hot, it will be a great spot to hang out.  The inside was bigger than I thought it would be too.  Service was average.  I felt the place was a bit pricey overall for simple Italian food, but I would go back.  I am happy to have them in the neighborhood.

tsyZck8Bl2j5teVg6nbPVw.text: We live in the area and had walked past this place a few times. It's got a pretty nonchalant exterior (a Red House) but when you walk inside it's a super cute little place. There's a nice bar upfront, a selection a baked goods and the dining area set a bit off back.   We ordered some minestrone soup and the Italian sausage with peppers and onions. It's was delicious!!!! Our waitress was so adorable and so attentive.   It's a great spot that I would frequent. Oh, they also have a walk up window where you can order ice cream and other desserts. In the summer they'll have a great patio with all sorts of games (ie Corn hole, bocce ball, etc). Best of all the patio area/walk up windows is pet friendly!   The owners came out and chatted for a bit.  They insisted that we try the ice cream which was delicious! Especially, the banana pudding! They were super nice.  Overall a great experience! Definitely check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of The Red House Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Red House Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Red House Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

u2ni6SSMP6pMw2bLsBpyCw.text: There are many things that you may WANT in your life but you just can't achieve. I had a microcosm of this frustrating life challenge at Red House Cafe.   Here was my painful journey:  I wanted the wings to be good.  They were potentially from frozen.   I wanted the sandwich (Cheesesteak) to be good.  It wasn't.    My friends wanted their food to be anything of value (Chicken Parm sub and also a Cheesesteak)  We cried in tandem as we paid $100 for 3 people.   I wanted the desserts to be awesome.  They were subpar except 1 which was decent.   I wanted there to not be a room outside that we kept seeing the employees go in and out from and when asked were told it's where the employees rip cigs because they are slow.  It exists.   Red House Cafe may be appropriately named because I don't see them being in the black on the balance sheet any time soon unless they make drastic changes.  BOLO for a "Coming soon...sign for this location. Better odds on that than betting on Red House Ca  Glimmers of hope:  Outdoor patio is a great venue.  Their breakfast (Blueberry Pancakes)   Yet to try the ice cream...

lEQ0nnYnRmK8Y07QDPZKXA.text: We met the owners who are great. They are very open to whatever u want and they will accommodate you. Now onto the food. Let me start off by saying I am veryyyyyyyyy picky when it comes to Italian food cause I cook all kinds and I'm Italian. The red sauce was ok, needed more basil and garlic in my opinion but everyone has their own version. Our daughter who is 15 liked it. The fettuccine Alfredo sauce needed alot more flavor.  The meat sauce was very good. I had the chicken parm sandwich and the chicken was cooked perfectly. Great outside seating area and their mimosas pours are awesome.

9I9eoNhhIoJYMe1T9EWcRQ.text: The hotdogs are amazing, I had the No. 1 and the Chilly slaw and both were very delicious. I got the onion rings and I loved how then they were.

photos.caption: Photo of The Red House Cafe - Charlotte, NC, United States

AjQg9uoGJ6ZbcJV6Nh4_xQ.text: The name of place made us think cafe- we were looking to have coffee or tea. We looked in and saw the bakery display so we went in only to discovered it was a dinning restaurant. We were going  to  walk out as we were not as hungry for a meal. We lingered to admire cute dinning area in front with  wide window,  then we saw their specialty "wine shake"! Ok this got  interesting. So we took the bait and decided to give this place a try. I head up not ordering the wine shake coz after more understanding of what  it is  , I thought it would be too sweet for my taste. My friend ordered beer. I  ordered white  wine instead and I got warm white wine. We ordered nacho chili, chili itself was decent but we had to remove  the nachos coz it had a weird smell (not smelly bad , but smell that nachos shouldn't have). My French fries were dark and limp. We were glad we did not order more than appetizers.  Good: cute front dinning area with window. Great beer menu especially how it was written with comparison to popular beers. (Meaning if you wanted  to know  how their specialty beer would taste like - they list mainstream beers that are similar to it.) Bad: server that knows how to  serve wine. Food is questionable.

F_efxrdGvVZ6zy1vD-E5Jg.text: Can't say enough about the service and very delicious food. Our party of 6 was sat right away!  A pleasant surprise compared to Heist down the street with an hour wait. Our party had pizza, meatball sandwich, meatloaf sandwich, and the philly cheese steak. Awesome experience! Go try it a gem for sure.

fx7KWIxiV8XOeL1vFw388A.text: Tried this new place for the first time on Saturday to celebrate Festivus with friends.  What an awesome experience!!!  The chicken parm was huge and done perfectly.  They even accommodated one of my gluten-free friends by leaving off the breading on her chicken.  When it comes to service and hospitality, Levi our waiter, Randy the manager, and Jimmy the owner get it.  Ate last night out on the backyard patio and it was wonderful!  Under the shade of a huge oak tree, our party of 7 were treated like family (the good kind ).

l8_pOTRYTrT0X7-jc52dcw.text: Stumbled across this gem and decided to walk in. This is such a cute family owned restaurant. Another wonderful customer service experience, which is a huge deal. I ordered the chicken Parmesan sandwich with fries. The sandwich was tasty though it could've used more seasoning/flavor. The fries not so much, they were very crunchy. I did enjoy my dessert. They are all homemade. I recommend the pineapple carrot cake. I plan to visit again to try some other things on the menu.Did I mention they also have an ice cream shop in the back of the restaurant. I'm definitely going back for that.
